body: What is the error that you're seeing? I've compiled locally using Go 1.18 under Windows from the current `main` just today with no problems.

This looks more like a support request than a clear bug or feature request. Please use the forum - https://forum.syncthing.net/ - for support, first by searching for any similar issues and then by posting a new one when required. The forum has a lot more eyes and friendly people on it than the issue tracker.

Thanks!

If it helps, the context of this report is in relation to OpenWrt: https://github.com/openwrt/packages/issues/18267

The master branch recently updated the Go lang host version to 1.18, several Go lang packages have been broken by this, most with the following error:

> ../../vendor/github.com/lucas-clemente/quic-go/internal/qtls/go118.go:5:13: cannot use "quic-go doesn't build on Go 1.18 yet." (untyped string constant) as int value in variable declaration

You can view the compile failure via the faillogs: https://downloads.openwrt.org/snapshots/faillogs/x86_64/packages/syncthing/compile.txt

The current package version in OpenWrt is 1.18.2, I tried building 1.19.2 but got other errors, but still related to go 1.18 incompatibility:

```
Building targets
github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18
# github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/cipher_suites.go:143:43: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/cipher_suites.go:413:45: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/cipher_suites.go:418:46: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/cipher_suites.go:426:45: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:177:10: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:183:13: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:211:62: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:973:14: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:1056:33: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/common.go:1496:41: undeclared name: any (requires version go1.18 or later)
../../vendor/github.com/marten-seemann/qtls-go1-18/conn.go:1056:33: too many errors
```

So we have a build issue with Go 1.18 currently. I haven't tried building from main, because OpenWrt prefers releases to pull via the Makefile

Hope that clarifies the original report.

Thank you for the additional information. I can confirm that if you download https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/releases/download/v1.19.2/syncthing-source-v1.19.2.tar.gz and try to use that to build Syncthing with Go 1.18, the compilation will fail with the errors listed above.

For info, it seems the presence of the vendor folder in the source tar.gz is the culprit, removing it before compiling works with Go 1.18.

There is another conversation around the same issue over on FreeBSD, and removing the vendor folder seems to be the solution: https://bugs.freebsd.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=262808#c6

An OpenWrt community member has already worked on a potential solution for the OpenWrt build system by essentially doing `rm -rf vendor` in the build folder before compiling, but thought you should be aware of it, if it's something that can be fixed upstream.

issue.title: Syncthing failed to build under GO1.18！！！

repository.name: packages
repository.description: Community maintained packages for OpenWrt. Documentation for submitting pull requests is in CONTRIBUTING.md

```
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/stats

# github.com/lucas-clemente/quic-go/internal/qtls
../../vendor/github.com/lucas-clemente/quic-go/internal/qtls/go118.go:5:13: cannot use "quic-go doesn't build on Go 1.18 yet." (untyped string constant) as int value in variable declaration
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/tlsutil
golang.org/x/crypto/blowfish
golang.org/x/text/runes
golang.org/x/crypto/bcrypt
`````

body: I believe #8260 should fix this issue (though it will require building with Go 1.17 or higher).

Looks like this is about the `go` directive in go.mod. From https://go.dev/doc/modules/gomod-ref#go:

> For packages within the module, the compiler rejects use of language features introduced after the version specified by the go directive. For example, if a module has the directive go 1.12, its packages may not use numeric literals like 1_000_000, which were introduced in Go 1.13.

However inconsistently this only applies to packages in the module itself, not dependencies, in "normal (modules) compilation". Now if we vendor dependencies, these are apparently treated like packages of the module itself. The package in question is gated behind a `go1.18` build flag, so there's no actual problem with compatibility.

I haven't been able to find any specifics on this behaviour or existing reports of similar issues in a quick search.

> I believe https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/8260 should fix this issue (though it will require building with Go 1.17 or higher).

That works indeed. But why - the `any` stuff is introduced in go1.18, not 1.17. Well anyway, we do only support the two latest go releases, so bumping to 1.17 is fine. Thanks for finding this!

> But why

I believe (with no evidence :joy:) that Go isn't resolving the go directives of modules correctly without the [module graph pruning](https://go.dev/ref/mod#graph-pruning) introduced in 1.17.

> > I believe #8260 should fix this issue (though it will require building with Go 1.17 or higher).
> 
> That works indeed. But why - the `any` stuff is introduced in go1.18, not 1.17. Well anyway, we do only support the two latest go releases, so bumping to 1.17 is fine. Thanks for finding this!

Is this patch going to be in the `1.19.3` release?

The problem has been resolved and the source code has been compiled using vebdor under GO1.18. The existing patches are compiled using their own go.mod。Version number: 1.19.2.
patch:
[patch.tar.gz](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/8456294/patch.tar.gz)
@AudriusButkevicius perhaps it would be good to wait for #8260 to be merged before closing this issue?
From what I understand the issue is todo with people having vendor directories, which is fixed by removing them?

@AudriusButkevicius Not quite. This project is currently providing a vendor folder in the source code releases, causing build issues on Go 1.18 as the dependencies in the vendor folder are for a older version of Go.
@jamesmacwhite The issue isn't with the dependencies in the vendor folder, the issue is Go using older (1.16) rules to parse newer (1.18) code (in qtls-go1-18).
